Why is literally every Q&A on Reddit now? Like we have our own version of Reddit and yes, there are the trolls and shitposters, The Boards Team is trying their best to transform the Boards culture into a substance-focused forum which would encourage meaningful, insightful posts.

You're not helping us by hosting Q&As on Reddit all the time and basically leaving us out cause our culture isn't good enough. 

Let's have a chat, what are the issues which drive you away from the Boards and to Reddit in particular? 

Do you have any suggestions for it off-hand? If not, let's come up with some.

> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=IjL26ftd,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2017-05-22T22:43:23.896+0000)
>
> Why is literally every Q&A on Reddit now? Like we have our own version of Reddit and yes, there are the trolls and shitposters, The Boards Team is trying their best to transform the Boards culture into a substance-focused forum which would encourage meaningful, insightful posts.
> 
> You're not helping us by hosting Q&As on Reddit all the time and basically leaving us out cause our culture isn't good enough. 
> 
> Let's have a chat, what would yare the issues which drive you away from the Boards and to Reddit in particular? 
> 
> Do you have any suggestions for it off-hand? If not, let's come up with some.

I am really interested to hear what Riot has to say on the topic. Cactopus said he doesn't like the Boards ~~but he never really specified why, he just said he liked the way reddit was more~~. EDIT: Never mind, he specified why.
Where did he say he doesn't like the Boards?

> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=IjL26ftd,comment-id=001600000000,timestamp=2017-05-23T02:11:43.646+0000)
>
> Where did he say he doesn't like the Boards?

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/63kzor/serious_why_isnt_rleagueoflegends_advertised_in/dfv1ls2/

> I've got some thoughts.
First, Reddit isn't even our biggest English-speaking community. The English-language Facebook page for League has nearly 15 times as many followers. Say what you will about its effectiveness for real discussion, but it's true. Also, there are bigger non-English speaking League communities. This is nowhere near the biggest League community on the web. 
**Second, and more to your point: For now, the boards are the "official Riot community" but they're not as big as Reddit. And they also kinda suck. I personally think they're not very useful except for giving developers an official, riot-owned platform for posting thoughts or interacting with players.** So IDK. I could imagine a world where we kill the boards and start pointing English-speaking players to this subreddit, but it'd be a pretty disruptive change. And this place is run by you guys, not us, so we're a little hesitant to post our own content (beyond AMAs) here for fear of drowning out what y'all are talking about.
It's true that Reddit threads sometimes give me stage 3 bronze v cancer, but it's the same way with the boards. **I think probably our current setup is fine, although I'd like to maybe kill the boards** and give the devs a place to post whatever they want on something like the Nexus.

My bad, looks like he did specify why he didn't like the Boards, I just have a bad memory.

That doesn't help us at all... he's right there are shitposts everywhere, something we'd all like to solve but killing the Boards will only redirect all the shitposts to Reddit. Kill Reddit too then?

Riot condemning their own platform is disgraceful tbh.

One thing that I really miss is that you can't view the full splash art for a skin before you buy it in the shop, you have to go to your collections and scroll through your skins there just to view it. Am I ever going to be able to just click on the skin in shop and view the whole splash art again?
Are you guys going to bring back the thing that tells us who invited us while we are afk? I kinda miss that thing{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
same I NEED IT BACK
Are there any plans to let players select the champion skin they want before the Load-out phase?
Any plans to help with the bronze conundrum? Not fair I play hours a day to try and climb the ladder for people to DC or just play like they don't care.
Why do you normally host the Q&As on reddit instead of the League of Legends page?
Because they can reach more people there from every server.

Will there be a place on the homescreen where it will show your current ping therefore you know before entering games

> [{quoted}](name=IIOxygenII,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=IjL26ftd,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-05-22T22:15:20.851+0000)
>
> Will there be a place on the homescreen where it will show your current ping therefore you know before entering games

Riot can't ping everyone in-client because that would put way too much server load. There's a workaround, however.
Since you're in NA, go to Command prompt and type 
> tracert 104.160.131.1

If you don't want to type that every time you check your ping, you can make a batch file. Just go to Notepad, write
> tracert 104.160.131.1
pause

and save that as a batch file. Run the batch file whenever you want to check ping.
